entities.description: The time frame during which the NSDUH survey is conducted.
Population that includes individuals not in active-duty military or institutional group quarters.
Population segment that is actively serving in the military.
Includes hospitals, prisons, nursing homes, and treatment centers.
Methodology of sample design which includes selecting specific sampling regions within each state.
Sampling design based on selecting samples from each state and the District of Columbia.
Different stages involved in the sampling process, including census tracts, area segments, and dwelling units.

relationships.description: The target population for the NSDUH survey excludes active-duty military and institutional group quarters.
The NSDUH employs volunteer sampling for conducting its survey.
The sampling methodology involves multiple stages such as census tracts, area segments, and dwelling units.
The sample design of the NSDUH is based on selecting samples from each state.
Efficient sampling methods ensure more precise estimates.
